title: L SEPTIMIO
LIBERALI
VIVIR AVG
VICANI VICI CERMALI OB
MERITA EIUS QVOT DECVRION
ET VICANIS VICOR VII SING
IN ANNOS X III IN PERPET REI
ET IN EAM REM FUNDOS XXI
OBLIGARI IVSSIT QVORUM
PARTEM VI LEGIS FALC NOMIN
DEDVCTAM AB TVTORIBVS
SEPTIMIAE PRISCAE MATRIS
SUAE LEPIDIA SEPTIMINA
POPVLO CONCESSIT
transcription: In annos X(denarios) III in perpet(uum) re[l(iquit)]
Et in eam rem fundos XXI
Obligari iussit quorumpartem VI legis Falc(idiae) nomin(e)
translation: (made by) vicani from Vicus Cermali on his merits
to have made a legacy for which each year the decurions and the vicani of the seven Vicis receive forever three denarii.
The legacy is guaranteed from the debenture of twenty one funds, from which the sixth part is deducted from
tutors of Septimia Prisca, her mother (mother of Lepidia Septimina), by virtue of the lex Falcidia.
Lepidia Septimina granted it to people.

bibliographies.citation: Cenerini Francesca. Notizie di economia dall'iscrizione riminese CIL XI 419. In: Mélanges de l'Ecole française de Rome. Antiquité, tome 109, n°1. 1997. pp. 21-30;
